intro: Gilia lutea var. longistylis, commonly known as the long-styled gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and is part of the Polemoniaceae family. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are typically tubular with two lips, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. The variety longistylis is distinguished by its elongated stamens, which contribute to its unique pollination strategy.
